page.title: 07Farnham Fire Service
page.content: The information below was taken from an interview with a local fireman. The busiest time of year is spring as dead bracken is still dry and because of cold nights there are still chimney fires.The most common type of call is small fires,grass and common fires.The least common is getting horses out of swimming pools.After qualifying as a fireman,men have to do practical drills on every shift.They also have to do breathing apparatus training twice a year in heat and smoke in the fire house at Brigade Training School. About one third of the 5OO calls attended by Farnham are things other than fires.The firemen also have to deal with road accidents,people locked out of their houses and animals trapped.
